page.title: 02THE SMITH-RYLAND ESTATE
page.content: The estate of Mr.C.Smith-Ryland a former Lord Lieutenant of Warwickshire comprises three farms,only{Debden Farm being in this area.At the present time most of this land is used for growing oil seed rape,wheat and winter beans. There are two belts of trees, mostly conifers,totalling 12 acres.This is used for windbreaks and timber for farm use.Of smaller concern are a pheasantry and gravel pits. {Debden Farm }belonged to the Glebe and was tenanted by the Canning family for 106 years,eventually being sold by the church in 1947 to Mr. W.Canning;upon his death the farm was bought by Mr.Smith-Ryland.Mr.J.Canning now 84 years old, still lives and farms at nearby Wasperton. Debden Farmhouse is now leased as a private residence,the estate being managed from offices in Sherbourne.
